Tuvshinjargal is a 27-year-old father who lives with his spouse and daughter in a ger, a traditional Mongolian felt tent, at an outer ger district, which lacks the basic infrastructure of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. 
In 2008, he worked at his well-known friend’s stall, then in 2009 he started his own printer ink cartridge business. But operating this kind of business alone is very difficult, so Tuvshinjargal's business fell under his sister’s company. 
Since then, he has attracted more customers and has become famous through the local companies. Now he rents a small apartment and operates his business successfully. Summer is a very busy season for his business, so he wants to stock up on all the necessary printer ink cartridges during this summer. 
Thus, he is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT) to purchase printer ink cartridges.

loans.use: to purchase printer ink cartridges to operate his business this summer

loans.name: Ivtisam

texts.en:
Ivtisam is a 38-year-old mother of four from Shaab in northern Israel. Several years ago when her husband lost his job, Ivtisam was determined to develop an income-making activity and help her family during this difficult period. She began selling cosmetics and clothing items from her car, a mobile store. Her business began making a decent profit and she decided to move her enterprise to a permanent location. Ivtisam found an excellent location for her store. She continues to hold onto her loyal customers and is drawing new clientele thanks to her excellent reputation. She offers delivery services for purchases and is selling clothing, undergarments, costume jewelry and gift items.

She needed this loan to purchase an air conditioner, an awning for her store entrance, stock and a delivery car.

Ivtisam wants to continue to invest in her business. While her husband found a steady job, her addition to the family significantly improves their monthly balance each month. In the future, she wants to publicize her business.

loans.use: To purchase an air conditioner, an awning, stock and a delivery car.

loans.name: Ángela Judith

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal La Sultana se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Angela, tiene 60 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene una hija de 15 años de edad la misma que  estudian en colegio. Su esposo está jubilado.

Ella junto al esposo tienen una tienda de comestibles y bazar en su casa, allí venden todo tipo de productos tanto de primera necesidad así como también productos de bazar y papelería, nos cuenta que en su negocio sus clientes encuentra de todo lo puedan necesitar esa es una de las razones por lo que sus clientes los prefieren y siempre compran en su local,  trabajan todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde,  ella lleva más de 20  años con su negocio y le va muy bien, nos cuenta que ahora con la ayuda de su esposo todo se le hace mas fácil ya que él le ayuda mucho.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar víveres, artículos de bazar y papelería. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 15 años  y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho en su negocio.
 
Su sueño es tener muy buena salud ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Members of “La Sultana” Communal Bank gather every two weeks in the province of Jipijapa, a province known by the name of the coffee sultan for the extensive cultivation of coffee which has an incomparable flavor, for its food, and for the quality of its people.

In this place we become acquainted with Ms. Angela, who is 60 years old, married, and from this relationship has one 15-year-old daughter who is currently in high school.  Her husband is retired.

She and her husband have a grocery store and hardware store out of their house.  There they sell all kinds of products from primary necessities to products you would find in a hardware and paper store.  They tell us that in their business their customers can find anything they might need.  This is one of the reasons that their clients prefer them and always buy from their store.  They work everyday from 6am to 8pm, and sometimes later.  She has had her business for 20 years and her business is going very well.  She tells us that now with the help of her husband everything will be easier because he helps her a lot.  

This loan will be utilized to stock up her store even more.  She will buy supplies, hardware goods, and paper materials.  She has been in the communal bank for the last 15 years and she likes it because the loans help her a lot with her business.  Her dream is that she and her family have very good health.

loans.use: to purchase supplies, hardware, and paper materials.

loans.name: Dolores Del Jesús

texts.es:
En la ciudadela La California de  Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco La Nueva California.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora  Dolores, tiene 53 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad pero aún viven con ella y están en los últimos años de la Universidad. Su esposo es profesor de un colegio de la ciudad.
 
Ella con intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y tener su independencia económica se dedica a la venta de ropa, productos naturales y cosméticos de Avon, Esika, Yanbal (artículos de belleza y perfumería). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, su hija le ayuda en ocasiones y  también lleva productos a ofrecer a sus compañeras en la universidad donde estudia, su hija le ayuda con las ventas ya que le da parte de sus ganancias para sus estudios. En la actualidad recién empezó a vender zapatos por catalogo y se está vendiendo muy bien. Lleva más de 12 años dedicada a esta profesión y le va muy bien.
 
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería, zapatos, ropa, productos naturales y cosméticos. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos se ha beneficiado mucho y ha aumentado sus ventas.
 
Sus sueños es seguir adelante con su negocio y tener salud que es lo más importante.
texts.en:
In the residencial community of La California in the Manabí capital, Portoviejo, known for many years as the city of the royal tamarinds, the communal bank "La Nueva California" meets every 15 days.

This is where we met Mrs. Dolores, 53, married and with two children who are adults but still live at home, as they are university students.  Her husband is a school teacher in the city.

In order to earn her own income and be economically independent, she sells clothing, natural products and beauty products and perfumes by Avon, Esika, and Yanbal.  She sells door-to-door and sometimes her daughter helps her by taking products to sell to her university friends.  Her daughter helps with sales and contributes part of her profits to cover school expenses.  Recently, Dolores began selling shoes by catalogue and business is doing fine.  She has over 12 years' experience doing what she does and things are going very well.

This loan will be used to buy more merchandise, such as shoes, clothing, natural products and cosmetics.  She has been in the communal bank since its beginning, and she enjoys it because the loans have helped her greatly in increasing her sales volume.

Her goal is to continue with her successful business and, more importantly, to stay healthy.

loans.use: To buy shoes, clothing, natural products and cosmetics.

loans.name: Anabelle Elionor

texts.es:
En la ciudadela La California de  Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco La Nueva California.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Anabelle. Tiene 53 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad, pero dos de ellos aun viven con ella y  estudian en la  Universidad. Su esposo es chofer profesional.

Ella hace ya varios años atrás aprendió corte y confección en una academia en la ciudad y obtuvo el título de modista, aprovechando sus conocimientos hace varios años atrás empezó su negocio, tiene un taller de costura en su casa y allí  confecciona todo tipo de ropa pero agrega que de hombres solo hace camisas y de damas y niños lo que sus clientes deseen, ella también elabora sabanas las mismas que vende en su local, nos cuenta que en temporadas de entrada a clases su trabajo aumenta mucho por lo cual debe trabajar hasta mas tarde. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00  hasta las 21h30 y cuando tiene prendas por entregar de urgencia hasta más tarde ya que siempre le gusta cumplir con su palabra. Lleva más de 15 años con su taller el mismo que le ha traído muy buenos beneficios para su vida.

Este crédito es para comprar, telas, hilos, botones y otros materiales de costura para elaborar las sabanas y sus prendas.  Esta desde el inicio en el Banco comunal y le gusta por la ayuda y  beneficios que recibe del banco.
 
Sus sueños son continuar como hasta ahora en su negocio y su vida personal.
texts.en:
In the residencial community of La California in the Manabí capital, Portoviejo, known for many years as the city of the royal tamarinds, the communal bank "La Nueva California" meets every 15 days.

This is where we met Mrs. Anabelle, 53, who is married and has three children who are all adults.  Two of them still live at home and go to the university.  Her husband is a professional chauffer.

Several years ago she learned how to sew at an academy in the city, where she earned the title of seamstress.  Taking advantage of her expertise she started her business several years ago and has a sewing shop at home where she makes all kinds of clothing.  For men she only makes shirts, but for women and children she makes anything the customers want.  She also makes sheets that she has for sale.  Also, when school season starts her work increases considerably and she has to work overtime.  Her normal hours are every day from 8:00 a.m. to 9:30 p.m., and when she has rush orders she works even later, because she always fulfills her promises.  She has been working in her shop for over 15 years and it has been very beneficial for her life.

This loan is to buy fabric, thread, buttons and other sewing supplies to make sheets and apparel.  She has been a member of the communal bank since the beginning and she enjoys it because of the help and benefits she receives.

Her goal is to continue in her business and personal life as she has until now.

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread, buttons and other sewing supplies.

loans.name: Doris Normita

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Bellavista de  Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Bellavista.

En este lugar vive la señora Doris, tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 3 hijos, dos ellos ya son mayores de edad y la menor tiene 7 años y estudia en escuela. Su esposo trabaja ocasionalmente.

Ella con la finalidad de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto poder ayudar a su  esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de productos de Yanbal (una revista de productos de belleza, perfumes y otros accesorios), es con esto que ella se ayuda ya que su esposo muchas vences no tiene trabajo ya que sufrió un accidente en el carro que conducía y después de eso ya no pudo trabajar normalmente. Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y sale la mayoría de los días a ofrecer sus productos, deja a crédito y cobra todas las semanas, lleva más de 5 años en este negocio y gracias a esto salen adelante.

Este nuevo crédito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, cremas, bisutería y  más productos que estén de promoción. Es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que siempre le han brindado.
 
Su meta es tener su casa ya que viven con familiares.
texts.en:
In the residencial community Bellavista in the Manabí capital, Portoviejo, known for many years as the city of the royal tamarinds, the communal bank "Bellavista" meets every 15 days.

This is where we met Mrs. Doris, 42, who is married and has three children, two of whom are adults and the youngest is seven years old and in school.  Her husband is a temporary worker.

In order to earn her own income so she could help her husband with the household expenses, she sells Yanbal products (beauty products, perfumes and accessories).  This way she helps her husband who does not always have work because he had a car accident and is unable to work full-time.  She sells door-to-door and goes out most days to offer her products which she leaves on credit and collects payment for weekly.  For over five years she has been in this business which has enabled her to get ahead.

This new loan will be used to buy perfumes, creams, costume jewelry and other products on sale.  She is one of the founding members of the communal bank and she enjoys it because of all the help she has recevied.

Her goal is to have her own house since she lives with relatives.

loans.use: To buy perfumes, creams, costume jewelry, etc.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en: Edna is from Calabayan, Ozamiz City. She is 47 years old. Edna is married and has three children. Edna used her last loan to repair an existing vehicle for better service. Her business has grown and become successful. Now, she's taking a new loan to purchase fertilizer for her banana plantation business. Positively, she hopes to be able to grow her business more.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Roselle

texts.en:
Roselle is 48 years old and married with 3 children.

Roselle works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell.

Roselle has borrowed and paid 9 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 7 years and also earns an income from electronic re-loading.

Roselle aspires to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
As a married parent of 5 children, Rosemarie works hard to support her family.

She has a internet cafe business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Rosemarie is borrowing PHP 40000 through NWTF to purchase a additional computer unit for her internet cafe business.

Rosemarie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money in order to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase an additional computer unit

loans.name: Antonina

texts.en:
Antonina works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Antonina requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell on her food stall.

She has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Antonina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell on her food stall.

loans.name: Luzvisminda

texts.en:
Luzvisminda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Luzvisminda requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing nets for her fishing business.

She has been in this business for 15 years.

In the future, Luzvisminda would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets for her fishing business.

loans.name: Dickson

texts.en:
Dickson is a resident of Kitale in Western Kenya and has been in active farming for three successive years. His farm currently produces milk, eggs and vegetables for the local market. Besides farming he gets additional income from his motorcycle transport business.

Dickson has requested a loan of 62,400 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He says this will increase his milk output to meet both family demand and earn additional income from sales to meet other basic needs.

However, he points out poor weather conditions as a major challenge.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to bring the dairy products to the local market

loans.name: Rena

texts.en:
Rena is 39 years old and single. Rena works very hard to provide for herself.

Rena runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like bread, soft-drinks and other miscellaneous items.

Rena has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future Rena would like to save enough to expand her business and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more items like bread, soft-drinks and other miscellaneous items for her store

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a resident and a farmer in the Kitale area of Western Kenya producing and selling milk, maize and horticultural products. He is married with two children aged eleven and ten years old. He has been in farming for seven years.

Peter has made a first loan request of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help him venture into poultry farming by buying poultry birds. He says the loan will help increase his family's income. He plans to expand his farm by buying more land.

Peter says the major challenges are inadequate rainfall and capital. He is grateful to Juhudi Kilimo for their support to smallholder farmers.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds

loans.name: Benilda

texts.es: Benilda de 50 años  es madre de un hijo de 28 años y vive en la ciudad de Barranquilla, con él y su nieta donde se dedica a mejorar la imagen personal y profesional de damas, caballeros y niños mediante técnicas de belleza que aplica en un pequeño salón de belleza ubicado en el lugar donde habita.  Ella es una emprendedora mujer que desde hace 20 años inició su propia aventura de negocios, guiada por la pasión con que desarrolla su tarea diaria y es por esto que sus clientes se pone en sus manos para salir de sus instalaciones bellos y relajados, no solo por la calidad conque aplica sus técnicas sino también por la calidez en su trato a ellos. Entre sus metas está la de adecuar su local para prestar servicios de estética, pues cuenta con suficiente espacio para hacerlo y también planea contratar un esteticista. Su mayor desafío es lograr diversificar apropiadamente su oferta con este nuevo servicio con el que sueña y tener el suficiente capital de trabajo para lograr alcanzar su propósito de crecimiento. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará productos de belleza como tintes, alicer, champo, cremas y colonias.  Con su credikiva lograr aumentar ligeramente su capital de trabajo, tener un recurso para comprar en mayor cantidad y lograr obtener buenos descuentos por parte de sus proveedores y esto es justamente las razones de éxito de su inversión.
texts.en:
Benilda, 50, has a 28-year-old son and granddaughter who she lives with in the city of Barranquilla.  She is a personal image professional who offers her beauty services to women, men and children at the beauty salon where she lives.  She is an entrepreneur who started her own business 20 years ago because of the passion she feels for the work she does every day.  Her customers put themselves in her hands so they can walk out beautiful and relaxed, not only because of the quality service she offers but also because of her warmth as a person.  

One of her goals is to renovate her beauty shop to offer other beauty services, since her shop has enough space; and she also plans to hire a beautician.  Her greatest challenge is diversifying her product offer correctly with this new service, and having enough working capital to meet her expansion goals.  She is currently applying for a CrediKiva loan which is her first through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation.  It will be used to buy beauty supplies such as hair color, straightener, shampoo, creams and colognes.  With the loan she will be able to increase her working capital somewhat and be able to buy more volume and obtain greater discounts from her suppliers.  This is why her investment will be successful.

loans.use: To buy beauty products such as hair color, straightener, shampoo, creams and colognes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for parts and labor to repair his van.

loans.name: Claribel

texts.es: Claribel de 49 años de edad vive en Puerto Colombia, municipio ubicado a orillas del mar,  con su esposo y sus dos hijos en las edades de 29 y 30 años. Desde hace 4 años se dedica al comercio, actividad con la que genera ingresos que apoyan el bienestar de su familia. Sus principales productos son los cosméticos de diversas marcas pues trabaja mediante el sistema de catálogos, es decir hace sus promociones con 4 guías especializadas de productos provenientes de multinacionales con las que establece sus relaciones comerciales. En su estrategia aborda el mercado de Puerto Colombia y también tiene clientes en la ciudad e Barranquilla ubicada a 20 minutos, ella para entregar el producto solicita el 50% y da crédito por el resto del valor de los productos que cada cliente escoja, teniendo en cuenta un plan de pagos que establece con cada uno, no mayor a 30 días.  Gradualmente sus solicitudes de pedidos se incrementan especialmente en las temporadas especiales, como la que ocurre próximamente, cuando celebran las familias el día de la madres. En su casa siempre cuenta con un inventario de productos que más rotan, para que sus clientes cuando le soliciten no se vayan con las manos vacías, pues siempre aprovecha las ofertas que traen las revistas, para impactar su mercado. Entre sus metas está el de organizar un pequeño almacén y por esto ha planeado su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará una vitrina metálica para organizar su inventario y productos que han sido solicitado por su clientela, como perfumes, accesorios femeninos, artículos de bisutería etc.  La razón de éxito de su inversión es su gran experiencia, la oportunidad de comprar promociones en mayores cantidades, y que esta la realizará justamente en una temporada donde las ventas se incrementan por efecto de los días especiales como el día de la madre, de la secretaria y del padre.
texts.en:
Claribel, 49, lives in Puerto Colombia, a town on the seacoast, with her husband and two children, aged 29 and 30.  For four years she has been in sales and generating enough income to help support the household.  Her main products are the different brands of cosmetics that she sells by catalogue.  She has four specialized catalogues from multinational companies with whom she does business.  Her market reaches customers ranging from Puerto Colombia to the city of Barranquilla which is about 20 minutes away.  She asks for a 50% downpayment upon delivery, then gives credit for the remaining value of ordered products.  Each customer has a payment plan, with terms no greater than 30 days.  

Gradually, her orders have increased, especially during celebrations such as Mother's Day, which is approaching.  At home she always keeps a stock of the more popular products so that customers do not have to leave empty-handed.  She always takes advantage of the sales offered in the catalogues to make an impact on her market.  

One of her goals is to have a small display case, so she has requested a CrediKiva loan, her first through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation.  She plans to use it to buy a metal display case to organize her inventory and products requested by her customers, such as perfumes, women's accessories, jewlery, etc.  The reason her investment will be successful is her great experience, the opportunity to buy larger volumes of sale items and  the celebration season, with days such as Mother's Day, Secretary's Day and Father's Day.

loans.use: To buy a display case for perfumes, women's accessories and jewelry.

loans.name: Javier

texts.es: Javier de 52 años,  vive en el municipio de Galapa con su cónyuge y tiene tres hijos en las edades de 12 a 25 años. Él se dedica a la fabricación de rulos  en maya metálica, negocio que inició por tradición familiar de su cónyuge y en el que trabajan todos los miembros de su grupo familiar. Su producto lo comercializa en almacenes de la ciudad de Barranquilla, el municipio de Maicao, Riohacha y Santa Marta y es la principal fuente de ingresos. Su meta es mejorar su vivienda y organizar muy bien su negocio, porque quiere crecer y cada día aumentar su bienestar y el de su familia. Su mayor desafío, es tener el capital de trabajo suficiente para lograr un crecimiento armonioso, esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará materias primas para elaborar en mayor volumen rulos metálicos. La razón de éxito de esta inversión es que cuenta con una gran clientela y la experiencia y el trabajo en su unidad familiar potencializan su crecimiento conjunto.
texts.en: Javier is 52 years old and lives in the town of Galapa with his spouse. They have three children aged 12 to 25. He makes hair curlers out of metal mesh; he started this business because it was his spouse's family tradition, and now all the members of his family work with him. He sells his product in shops of the town of Barranquilla, in Maicao, in Riohacha and in Santa Marta, and this is his primary source of income. Javier's goal is to improve his house and to better organise his business, because he wants it to grow. He also wants to improve, day after day, the standard of living of his family. The main challenge for his business is to secure enough funds to ensure smooth growth; this is why he asks for a loan with Kiva. It is his first loan with field partner Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will use the money to buy raw materials to produce a greater quantity of metal hair curlers. He is confident that this investment will be a success because he has many customers already and because his family has the experience and willingness to work necessary to effective growth.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to increase his production.

loans.name: Leze

texts.en:
Leze is married with two children. Her younger one is attending the national university and she pays for his education. Her family has been living in the same village for three generations. 

Leze has been in the retail business for over 20 years. She is grateful that with the first loan from VFA she was able to open up a small grocery store selling just a few food items.  What makes her business successful is that her store is the only one in the village; the majority of her customers purchase items on credit and she has established and nurtured a good relationship with her clientele. 

Leze is requesting a loan to purchase a larger inventory of food and toiletries items and expand her store.This will enable her to provide customers with a wider variety of grocery items. Records show that she has borrowed in the past from VFA and repaid her loan in full and on time.

loans.use: To buy food items and toiletries

loans.name: Elezenia

texts.es: Elezenia de 34 años vive al sur de la ciudad con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 6 y 16 años. Allí se dedica a mejorar la imagen personal y profesional de sus clientes porque es estilista de belleza y también vende mercancía variada. Su negocio inició desde que estudiaba y se dedicaba a la actividad comercial vendiendo prendas de oro golfi y camisetas, para que sus compañeras de estudio se los pagaran a plazos. Al terminar su carreta técnica de belleza, como no encontró empleo, agregó a la venta de mercancías la oferta de servicios a domicilio de corte de cabello, pedicure, manicure etc. y también los fines de semanas vende bebidas frías. Su meta mas adelante es tener un local donde funcione su salón de belleza y un punto de exhibición de sus productos incluyendo refrescos y cosméticos entre otras mercancías. Su mayor desafío es tener el capital de trabajo suficiente para poder lograr su meta poco a poco. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará productos capilares, cosméticos refrescos y bebidas, para fortalecer sus tres negocios en una temporada en la cual usualmente sus ventas se incrementan como la celebración del día de las madres, del padre,  secretarias etc.
texts.en: Elezenia is 34 years old. She lives in the south of the city with her spouse and two children, aged 6 and 16. There she dedicates herself to improving the personal and professional image of her customers, because she is a beauty stylist, and she also sells a variety of merchandise. Her business began when she was a student, and she dedicated herself to commercial activity, selling Golfi gold jewelry and t-shirts to her fellow students, who paid her in installments. Upon finishing her technical degree as a beautician, since she did not find work, she added personal services to her sale of merchandise, offering haircuts, pedicures, manicures, etc., in customers' homes. Also, on weekends she sells cold drinks. Her goal for the future is to have a shop where she can set up her beauty salon as well as a display area for her products, including beverages and cosmetics, among other merchandise. Her greatest challenge is to have enough working capital to achieve her goal little by little. This is the reason for her application for a Kiva loan, her first financing with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. She will use it to buy hair care products, cosmetics, and beverages, to strengthen her three businesses in a season during which her sales usually increase, with the celebration of Mother's Day, Father's Day, Secretaries' Day, etc.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, cosmetics, and beverages.

loans.name: Sibeliz

texts.es: Sibeliz  de 38 años vive con su cónyuge y sus 3 hijos en las edades de 8 a 14 años en el municipio de Galapa, donde se dedica desde hace 7 años, a mejorar la imagen personal y profesional de damas, caballeros y niños mediante técnicas de belleza que aplica desde el lugar donde habita. Su idea de negocio nació una vez terminó de capacitarse en el Servicio Nacional de Aprendizaje “SENA” y decidió emprender su propia aventura de negocio; así fue que  con el apoyo de su cónyuge, con un dinero que le regaló, lo convirtió en su capital semilla de inicio.  Su meta es tener un local comercial donde concentrar su clientela para atenderla en un ambiente muy confortable. Su mayor desafío, es tener el capital de trabajo suficiente, para lograr un crecimiento armonioso, esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará insumos de peluquería en mayor proporción, como productos capilares, champo, enjuague, lociones, las cuales utiliza en su tarea diaria y ganará descuentos por comprar en mayor volumen. Este es justamente la razón de éxito de su credikiva, acompañada de su gran experiencia en este negocio y su disposición para hacerlo crecer.
texts.en: Sibeliz is 38 years old, she lives with her spouse and her 3 children (aged 8 to 14) in the town of Galapa. For the past seven years, she has used her home as a beauty salon where she uses beauty techniques to improve the personal and professional image of ladies, gentlemen, and children. Her idea for a business was born after she finished her State certification at SENA (National Service for Learning a Trade). That is how she decided to start her own business, using as seed capital a sum of money gifted to her by her spouse. Sibeliz's goal is to buy commercial premises where she would be able to attend to her customers in a more comfortable fashion. Her biggest challenge is to secure enough capital to attain smooth growth, and this why she asks for a Kiva loan. It is her first loan with field partner Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use the funds to buy more beauty products: hair products, shampoo, conditioner, lotions. Buying greater quantities of these products, which she uses daily in her line of work, will help her obtain a discount for buying in bulk. This is, along with her great experience in this trade and her willingness to make her business grow, why she is confident that her loan will be put to good use.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products such as hair products, shampoo, conditioner, lotions.

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en:
Dominic is a businessman who runs a grocery store. He has operated the business for two years. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has managed to grow his business because he has been trained in business management skills. He has also learnt how to save his money.

Dominic hopes to expand his business into wholesale in the future. He has requested 20,000 Kenya shillings to add to his stock of tomatoes and onions.

loans.use: To add to his stock of tomatoes and onions

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a farmer and the father of six children aged between fifteen and one year old. He lives with his family in their rural home in Kitale, Western Kenya, where he carries out farming and sells the main products, which include vegetables, milk, maize and horticultural products to the local markets.

Moses has made a loan request of 62,400 KES from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He says this will enable him to meet his family's basic needs. He hopes to grow his farming business and make his family more financially secure in the future.

He laments the high cost of inputs and inadequate capital sources.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Cristina Group

texts.es:
El grupo Cristina lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras, emprendedoras, sencillas y carismáticas. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Miriam de 46 años quien se dedica a la realización y comercio de bebidas y comidas típicas como pinolillo, pozol, tiste y tamales entre otros productos a base de maíz. Este negocio lo inicio hace 16 años aproximadamente con lo cual saco adelante a sus cinco hijos de los cuales las hijas mujeres le ayudan en la producción de estos frescos con la tostada de maíz, cacao, molerlo…etc. y solo el menor de 11 años depende de ella.
El crédito lo invertirá en maíz, cacao, canela, semilla de jícaro, leña…etc.
Las otras integrantes son Martha quien hace 12 años inicio con la venta de chiverías y poco a poco fue aumentándolo hasta tener una pulpería surtida y María tiene una sastrería la cual inicio hace 10 años realizando una docena de pantalones.
texts.en:
The group "Cristina" consists of three hardworking, enterprising, modest, and charismatic women. The group coordinator is Sra. Miriam, age 46. Her business involves preparing and selling traditional food and beverages such as "pinolillo" (a beverage made from cornmeal and cacao), "pozol" (a drink made from fermented corn dough), "tiste" (another type of beverage made from corn and cacao), tamales, and other dishes made from corn. She started this business approximately 16 years ago so that she could help her children get ahead. Her grown daughters help her with toasting and grinding both the corn and the cacao. Her youngest child is 11 years old and dependent on her. Miriam's loan will be invested in corn, cacao, cinnamon, calabash seeds, firewood, and other supplies.

The other members are as follows: • Martha started out by selling yogurt 12 years ago. She gradually grew her business and now has a well-stocked grocery store. • María has a tailoring shop that she started 10 years ago. She produces trousers by the dozen.

loans.use: to buy corn, cacao, cinnamon, calabash seeds, firewood, and other supplies.

loans.name: Medaly

texts.es:
Medaly tiene 30 años, es madre soltera, tiene de 2 hijos (de 8 años y uno de 8 meses). Ella y sus hijos viven en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito de San Ramón – Chanchamayo.

Ella es una mujer luchadora. Recientemente se separó del padre de sus hijos y empezó a trabajar independientemente. Hace 2 años empezó con el negocio de venta de panes y bizcochos de una marca nacional. La mercadería la adquiere al por mayor en la ciudad de Lima y vende en su distrito de casa en casa. “Lo que más vendo son panes en molde y bizcochos dulces como alfajores y piononos”, comenta. De sus ventas gana un porcentaje y recibe un sueldo como vendedora. Le gusta su trabajo porque está en contacto constante con los clientes y por la libertad de distribuir su tiempo como a ella le parezca;  de esta manera no descuida a sus hijos y los atiende para que ellos vayan limpios y seguros a la escuela. Medaly quisiera abrir un pequeño restaurante, es una de sus metas más próximas, para ello deberá trabajar duro.

Éste es su primer crédito con MFP, por eso se compromete en ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. 
Invertirá el dinero en la compra de panes de trigo y harina, además de bizcochos dulces para continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Medaly is 30 and the single mother of 2 kids, ages 8 and 8 months. She and her children live in their own home which is located in the San Ramon district of Chanchamayo. 

She is a fighter. She recently separated from the father of her children and began working independently. Two years ago she started selling a national brand of bread and cookies. She buys her merchandise wholesale in the city of Lima, then sells door to door in her district. “What I sell the most of are loaf breads and pastries such as alfajores [soft cookies that sandwich a milk and sugar filling] and piononos [sweet pastry roll],” she says. 

She earns a percentage of her sales, and she receives a salary for being a saleswoman. She likes her work because she is constantly in contact with her customers, and because it gives her freedom to spend her time as she sees fit. This allows her to take care of her kids and make sure that they are sent off to school clean and safe. 

Medaly would like to open a small restaurant; it is one of her goals that she wants to focus on next. To achieve this goal, she is going to have to work hard. 

This is her first loan with MFP, and she commits to being on time with the monthly loan payments. She will invest the loan in the purchase of wheat and flour breads, in addition to sweet baked goods to continue with her business.

loans.use: increase her merchandise

loans.name: Edgardo

texts.es: Edgardo  de 45 años de edad vive con su cónyuge y sus 2 hijos en el municipio de Soledad, donde se dedica a la elaboración de lavaderos en material de granito, que fabrica en un espacio a un lado de su vivienda. Sus ventas las realiza al detal entre vecinos, familiares y referidos que son su principal mercado doméstico y también provee a una constructora del sector mediante encargos que estos hacen, en mayor volumen que el acostumbrado. Su meta es hacer crecer su negocio, generando empleos y teniendo un mayor capital con el cual contar oportunamente y este es justamente su gran desafío y la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el que comprará cemento blanco, granito blanco y negro, arena, cal y otros insumos con los que planea aumentar su producción de lavaderos y conseguir buenos precios, para lograr la disminución de sus costos. Esta es justamente la razón de éxito de su inversión, además de su experiencia y capacidad de trabajo.
texts.en: Edgardo is 45 years old and lives with his spouse and his two children in the town of Soledad, where he makes washbasins out of granite in a space near his home. He sells them to neighbours, family members, and through referrals. They constitute they main customer base, but he also sells his products to a construction company of the area, which places orders in greater quantities than usual. Edgardo's goal is to make his business grow; he would like to hire people as well as to generate more capital to have at his disposal. This is his great challenge and what motivates him to ask for a Kiva loan, which is his first loan with field partner Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will use this loan to buy white cement, white and black granite, sand, lime and other raw materials. He will use these to increase his production of washbasins and he will also try to obtain better prices in order to reduce his costs. This is why, together with his experience and willingness to work hard, he is confident his investment will pay off.

loans.use: to buy white cement, white and black granite, sand, lime and other raw materials.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 53 years old, married and has eight children. To earn a living, he runs a motorbike transport business.  He also has a retail shop which earns him extra income. He employs one person in his shop. Through Faulu Kenya, he has been trained in business management skills. This has helped him to improve his businesses.

Patrick hopes to expand his business in the future.  He has requested 10,000 Kenya shillings to buy sugar, cooking fat, rice and maize flour.

loans.use: To buy sugar, cooking fat, rice and maize flour

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 35 years old. She runs a hardware shop to earn a living. She has operated the business for two years. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has managed to access financial resources, gained business management skills and learnt how to save her money.

Irene hopes to grow her business in the future. She has requested a loan of 100,000 Kenya shillings to buy paint.

loans.use: To buy paint

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 39 years old, married and has two children. To earn a living, she sells goats. She has engaged in the business for three years. Thanks to Faulu Kenya for training her in business management skills.  This has helped her to improve her business and employ one person.  

Ruth hopes to grow her clientele in the future.  She has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy goats.

loans.use: To buy goats

loans.name: Heidy

texts.es: Heidy de 36 años de edad vive en el municipio de Soledad lugar donde tiene una tienda de productos de belleza y vende además herramientas y equipos profesionales.  Los principales productos son tintes, champo, enjuagues, lociones, e implementos y maquinarias que utilizan en salones de belleza y escuelas o centros educativos de enseñanza, de técnicas de mejoramiento de la imagen personal y profesional. Su mayor propósito es lograr un crecimiento armónico y ser reconocido por la calidad de los productos que ofrece en su tienda. Su máximo desafío es lograr captar una clientela que compre en mayor volumen y tener un capital de trabajo suficiente, para responder a una potencial y creciente demanda. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará  productos de belleza en mayor volumen, para ganar descuentos y tener un inventario que impacte a su clientela, para de esta manera, alcanzar un mayor volumen en sus ventas, especialmente en esta época en la cual se incrementan, porque los salones de belleza le compran en mayor cantidad, para responder a su vez al día de las madres, de la secretaria y del padre.
texts.en: Heidy is 36 years old and lives in the town of Soledad, where she sells beauty products as well as tools and professional equipment. Her main products are hair dyes, shampoo, conditioner, lotions, and tools and machines used in beauty salons and educational institutions that teach hairdressing and techniques for improving someone's personal and professional image. Heidy's main goal is to attain smooth growth and to be recognised as a seller of high-quality products. Her main challenges are to gain customers that order in greater quantities and to have enough capital to respond to a potentially increasing demand. This is why she asks for a Kiva loan, which is her first loan with field partner Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use the funds to buy beauty products in greater quantities, which will net her a discount. She wants the range of goods she offers to make an impression on her customers, which will help her sell more, particularly at this time of year, where demand is higher, because beauty salons order more so as to face the demand for Mother's Day, Secretary's Day and Father's Day.

loans.use: to buy beauty products in greater quantities.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luis de 28 años de edad vive con su cónyuge y se dedica al comercio de correas y hebillas al por mayor y al detal, actividad que desde niño ha sido su mayor habilidad y en la que tiene una impresionante aptitud. Anteriormente Luis  se encontraba en la parte de afuera, de un centro comercial importante del sur de la ciudad, pero fue reubicado por el estado local y ahora se encuentra en un sitio que destinaron para congregar a los vendedores ambulantes. Su trabajo lo desarrolla desde las 9:00 a.m. a las 9:00 p.m. de lunes a domingo sin descansar; la competencia de este sector es alta, pero se respetan y se apoyan y él trabaja con una vocación de servicio, que atrae a sus clientes. Su credikiva, es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará correas, hebillas, accesorios femeninos y masculinos, aprovechando que se acerca la temporada, en la cual las familias celebran el día de la madre, el del padre, de la secretaria y en esta época la demanda crece y las ventas se incrementan, lo cual hace que esta inversión tenga éxito y logre aumentar ligeramente su capital de trabajo y responder a su fiel clientela. Porque su sueño mas importante es lograr tener su vivienda propia y ampliar su microempresa, razón por la cual se esfuerza sin cesar para que su familia tenga el bienestar soñado.
texts.en: Luis is 28 years old. He lives with his spouse, and he works in trade, selling belts and buckles on a wholesale and retail basis. Since he was a child, this activity has been his greatest skill, for which he has an impressive aptitude. Previously, Luis operated his business outside of an important shopping center in the south of the city, but he was relocated by the local state and he is now set up in a place designated to gather together the mobile vendors. He works from 9:00 a.m. to 9:00 p.m. from Monday through Sunday, without resting. The competition in this field is intense, but they respect and support each other, and he works with a dedication to service which attracts his customers. His Kiva loan is the first financing he is undertaking with the Mario Santo Domingo, and he will use it to buy belts, buckles, and men's and women's accessories. He is taking advantage of the fact that the season is approaching in which families celebrate Mother's Day, Father's Day and Secretaries' Day, and during this season demand grows and sales increase. This will make his investment successful, and he will be able to increase his working capital slightly and serve his loyal customers. His most significant dream is to be able to have his own home and expand his microenterprise, and for that reason, he is exerting himself without stopping, so that his family will have the well-being he dreams of.

loans.use: to buy belts, buckles, and men's and women's accessories.

loans.name: Alexandra Maribel

texts.es: Alexandra es socia del Bancomunal Alondras, tiene35 años de edad, es  casada y tiene 2 hijos; es socia de FINCA Perú hace 8 años. Se dedica a la venta de palos de leña. Durante todo este tiempo que es socia logro muchos de sus sueños como el de construir su propia vivienda, está agradecida a la institución por las capacitaciones que recibe en su Bancomunal y por las facilidades de crédito que le ofrecen. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de palos de eucaliptos para venderlos en su negocio.
texts.en:
Alexandra is a member of the Communal Bank "Alondras" (Larks). She is 35 years old, married, and has two children. Alexandra has been with FINCA Peru for eight years. She sells wooden logs. Throughout the entire time that she has been a member, Alexandra has accomplished many of her dreams, such as building a home of her own. She is grateful to FINCA for the training provided by her Communal Bank and the loan services that are offered.

The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of eucalyptus logs to sell in her business.

loans.use: to purchase logs of eucalyptus wood.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies to make more bed linens as well as cold meats to fulfil orders.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es: La socia Concepcion nació en la provincia de Huaraz del Departamento de Ancash pero actualmente vive en la ciudad del Cusco, tiene 59 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos. Concepcion se dedica a la venta de chicha y tiene una pequeña picantería, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo jora. Ya son 10 años que se dedica a la venta de chicha de jora.    La socia Concepción pertenece al banco comunal “Siempre Adelante” de la Asociacion Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco.
texts.en: This member, named Concepcion, was born in the province of Huaraz, Department of Ancash. Now she lives in the city of Cuzco. She is 59 year old and is in a common law marriage. She has three children. Concepcion sells chicha and has a small restaurant. At this time she needs the loan to buy ingredients, jora (yellow maize) for example. She has been selling jora for ten years. Concepción belongs to the “Siempre Adelante” communal bank of the  Asociacion Arariwa in the city of Cuzco.

loans.use: To buy ingredients, for example, jora (yellow maize).

loans.name: Alirio

texts.es: Alirio invirtió muy bien su credikiva anterior y le fue muy bien, el compró materias primas e insumos con los cuales elaboró productos fritos, una cava y un nuevo termo para los jugos de naranja. Así mismo le alcanzó hasta para reparar su carro de jugos en todo lo que tiene que ver con latonería y pintura, su medio de transporte le quedó muy agradable a la vista y mas útil que nunca, por eso se siente muy satisfecho. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva para realizar adecuaciones en el local que le adjudicaron con todos los vendedores  y el debe realizar el acabado de paredes, pisos y construir su lavaplatos para que todo se vea muy elegante y llame la atención, el interés y despierte la acción de compra de sus clientes. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es que se siente muy agradecido con su familia, por el apoyo económico recibido, de parte de Kiva y de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, sus ingresos ahora han mejorado, así como su liquidez, y que él espera seguir recibiendo este apoyo.
texts.en: Alirio invested his previous Kiva loan very well. He bought raw materials and ingredients to make fried food, as well as a storage space and a new container for orange juice. He also had enough to repair his juice cart's bodywork and paint so his transportation looks very good and more useful than ever. Because of this, he feel very satisfied. Right now he is applying for a new Kiva loan to remodel the locale he was awarded with other merchants. He must finish the walls, floors and build a dishwasher so that it will look elegant and get people's attention and interest and get his customers to buy. His message to the Kiva lenders is that he feels very grateful, with his family, for the financial support he has received from Kiva and the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. His income now has improved as well as his liquidity. He hopes to keep receiving this support.

loans.use: to do some remodeling on the locale he was awarded with all the merchants. He must finish the walls and the floors and build a dishwasher.

loans.name: Betty

texts.es:
Betty, percibe ingresos como empleada de una funeraria ofreciendo servicios fúnebres ya que anteriormente, tenia un negocio de ferretería que lo cerró, por lo cual requiere el crédito, para reactivar su negocio, comprar fierro, tornillos, clavos y otros productos que se venden en una ferretería, y así mejorar sus ingresos y calidad de vida.
Betty, esta casada y tiene un hijo con el cual no vive ya que el es independiente. Betty con su trabajo ayuda en los gastos familiares, de alimentacion, servicios básicos, salud,  ya que su esposo no cuenta con buenos ingresos porque es chofer transportista.
Para el futuro sueña que su negocio comercial de ferretería pueda ser económicamente rentable para poder ayudar a su familia más que todo a su esposo ya que no cuenta con un seguro medico.
Betty, vive en la zona Obispo Bosque de la ciudad de La Paz, en la casa de sus suegros ocupando solo dos habitaciones pequeñas.
Es la tercera vez que solicita el crédito en IMPRO y la sexta  en KIVA. Durante este tiempo demostró honradez y puntualidad en el pago de sus cuotas.
Anteriormente Betty no trabajaba, pero ahora tiene toda la intención de despegar con la ferretería
texts.en:
Betty earns income as an employee at a funeral parlor that provides funeral services. She previously managed a hardware business, but she closed it down. However, she is requesting a loan so that she can reopen her business. She will buy iron, screws, nails, and other products that are sold in a hardware store. This will improve her income and her quality of life.

Betty is married and has a son who no longer lives with her since he is independent. She works in order to help with family expenses such as food, utilities, and health care. Her husband does not earn a good income because he works as a driver. In the future, Betty dreams of seeing her hardware business becoming profitable so that she can help her family, most of all her husband who does not have heath insurance. Betty lives in the District of Obispo Bosque in the city of La Paz, at the home of her in-laws where she and her husband occupy two small rooms.

This is the thirteenth time she has requested a loan from IMPRO and the sixth time with Kiva. Throughout this time, she has demonstrated honesty and punctuality with her loan payments. Betty was not able to work before, but now she has every intention of launching her hardware business.

loans.use: to buy iron, nails, screws, and other hardware items.

loans.name: Sameeha

texts.en:
Sameeha is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her son Ra'fat appears in her Kiva profile photo, pictured next to the taxi whose price the family wants to complete.

Sameeha is a 50-year-old woman; she is married and a mother to two sons and one daughter. Her elder son is employed and gets a low salary. Her other son Ra'fat has been a taxi driver for four years, which has been a profitable project, but also needs more support to cover costs.

Sameeha is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to help her son Ra'fat cover the costs of purchasing a new taxi. Taking out this loan will enable Sameeha to help her son get a new taxi, which will allow him to work extra hours and contribute to increasing the family's income.

About this loan product:

FATEN offers loans that are customized for Muslim borrowers. A key principle of Islam is the prohibition of charging interest on a loan. This prohibition is based on the belief that money is only a medium of exchange and has no value in itself. In order to offer loans in a manner that is consistent with borrowers' values, FATEN charges 0% interest on this loan. However, FATEN does charge a servicing fee to cover its costs. The loan amount you see listed on Kiva includes both the loan principal and the servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you according to this loan’s repayment schedule.

loans.use: To complete the price of purchasing a taxi

loans.name: Muriyesu Group

texts.fr:
Jean fait partie du groupe Muriyesu. Le nom du groupe signifie «In Jesus». Il a 70 ans, il est marie avec 5 enfants de 28 ans  à 48 ans. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.
Jean est commerçant. C’est son troisième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des charbons, bois de chauffage, tourbe...etc
Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de donner les services de qualité. Dans les prochaines années, Jean voudrait devenir le grand commerçant. Avec les profits, il prévoit de payer les frais scolaire et médicaux pour ses enfants et améliore le bien être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Jean forms part of a group called Muriyesu (“In Jesus”). He is a 70-year-old father of five children aged between 28 and 48, and he went to elementary school for six years.
Jean is a vendor, and this is his third loan cycle with ACB. He plans to use his loan to purchase coal, firewood, peat, etc.
His strategy for business growth is to provide quality services, and over the coming years he would like to become a successful vendor. He hopes to use his profits to pay for his children’s schooling and medical expenses and improve his family’s wellbeing.

loans.use: to purchase coal, firewood and peat

loans.name: Ngirankugire / Rsz Group

texts.fr:
Jean fait partie du groupe Ngirankugire/Rsz. Le nom du groupe signifie «Aide l’une à l’autre ». Il a 52 ans, il est marie avec 5 enfants de 4 ans  à 9 ans, dont 5 scolarises. Il a 2 personnes en charge autre que ses enfants. Son niveau d’éducation est de 3 ans de secondaire.

Jean est commerçant. C’est son troisième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin de renforcer son  commerce de boutique(acheter 50 kgs de farine de maïs,du sel du riz etc...

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de demande d’autre crédit pour renforce son activités commerciale. Dans les prochaines années, Jean voudrait devenir le grand commerçant. Avec les profits, il prévoit de payer les frais scolaire pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
Jean is a member of the Ngirankugire/Rsz group.  The group's name means "To help one another".  He is 52 years old, married, and has 5 children, ages 4 to 9 years old, who all attend school.  Besides his children, he supports two other persons.  Jean left school after completing three years of secondary school.

Jean works in retail business.  This is his third loan cycle with ACB.  He will use his loan to strengthen his retail shop business by buying 50 kg of corn flour, salt, rice and other items.  

In order to expand his business, his strategy is to request other loans to strengthen his activity.  In the coming years, Jean would like to become a major retailer.  With the profits, he is planning to pay his children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy 50 kg of corn flour, salt and rice for his retail shop business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers and pay for the cost of labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a bigger truck.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is a 42-year-old Lebanese single woman. She lives with her parent and a sibling. Alice and her brother find it really hard to cover their expenses after the heavy costs of life even though they’re both working. So in 2006, she decided to open her own workshop where she sells artisanal products such as silver items. Her job consists of making special designs on these products to attract customers to make purchase orders. In addition to that work, she creates stamps as well. Today, she’s asking for a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase new artisanal items for her shop. She notes that this will allow her increase her sales after making special offers and sales on her products. In the future, she plans to include artisanal clothes to her shop.

loans.use: to purchase new artisanal items for her shop

loans.name: Olga Luisa

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Nuevos Horizontes se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 

En este lugar vive la señora Olga, tiene 39 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 19, 16 y 15  años de edad, los mismos que estudian en colegio. El marido es comerciante.

Ella es una muy buena madre y ama de casa que además tiene un bazar en su casa, allí vende ropa, zapatos, perfumes, cosas para regalos y tarjetas para toda ocasión, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 19h00, nos cuenta que lleva tres años con su negocio y que tiene bastante clientes que llegan a comprar en su local. Ella para surtir su negocio viaja a Guayaquil o Cuenca a comprar mercadería.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su bazar, va a comprar ropa, zapatos, tarjetas, entre otras cosas. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 5 años,  es la fiscal de pagos del grupo y le gusta por ayuda que le dan con los créditos. 

Su sueño es que sus hijos sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "Nuevos Horizontes" (New Horizons) meets every 15 days in the canton of Jipijapa, which is known by its nickname "The Sultana of Coffee" because of its extensive coffee crop that has an incomparable flavor. This area is also known for its food and the warmth of its people.

Sra. Olga lives in this place. She is 39 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has three children (ages 19, 16, and 15) who are in school. Her husband is a merchant.

Olga is an excellent mother and homemaker who manages a bazaar in her home. There she sells clothing, shoes, perfumes, as well as gifts and greeting cards for all occasions. She works every day from 8am to 7pm. Olga says that she has been this business for three years and has enough customers who come to her shop to buy things. In order to restock her business, she travels to Guayaquil or to Cuenca so that she can buy merchandise.

This loan will be used to restock her bazaar. She will buy clothing, shoes, greeting cards, and other items. Olga has been with her Communal Bank for five years and serves as the treasurer of her group. She enjoys being a member because of the help the loans have given her. Her dream is to see her children become successful professionals.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, greeting cards, and other items.

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en:
Innocent is single. He has been a rice farmer for 7 years. He would like to get this loan to buy seeds and support labor costs to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to get more output.
The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To cover labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Valens

texts.en:
Valens is married to a farmer. He has been a rice farmer for 4 years. He would like to get this loan to buy seeds and support labor costs to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to get more output.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay for seeds and labor costs.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is married with two children between 4 and 7. Neither of them is enrolled in school. His wife works as a farmer. He has been a rice farmer for 7 years. He would like to get this loan to buy seeds and support labor costs to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to get more output.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay for labor costs and seeds during rice production.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Azarius

texts.en:
Azarius is married with four children between 9 and 23. All of them are enrolled in school. His wife works as a farmer. He has been a rice farmer for 6 years. He would like to get this loan to buy seeds and support labor costs to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to get more output.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay for labor and buy seeds during rice production.

loans.name: Abakoranabushake/rsz Group

texts.fr:
Jean Damascène fait partie du groupe Abakoranabushake/Rsz. Le nom du groupe signifie «commençants courageux». Il a 39 ans, il est marie avec 4 enfants de 7 ans  à 14 ans, dont 4  scolarises. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Jean Damascène est commerçant. C’est son deuxième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin de renforcer son business de commerce de détails (acheter des jus, de l'eau et des biscuit pour vendre).

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de demande d’autre crédit pour renforce son activités. Dans les prochaines années, Jean Damascène voudrait devenir le grand commerçant. Avec les profits, il prévoit de payer les frais scolaire pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
Jean Damascène is a member of the Abakoranabushake/Rsz. Group. The group’s name means “brave beginners.” He is 39 years old, married, and has four children ranging from 7 to 14 years of age; four of the children are in school. His educational level is six years of primary school.

Jean Damascène is a vendor. This is his second loan cycle with ACB. He will use his loan to strengthen his retail business by buying juice, water and biscuits to sell. 

His business strategy is to keep taking out loans to strengthen his business. In the years to come, Jean Damascène would like to become a major vendor. He plans to use his revenues to cover the education costs for his children.

loans.use: to buy juice, water and biscuits to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more cows for re-sale and milk production.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is aged thirty, single and has been in farming for  eight years with his farm producing and selling maize, beans and milk on the local market. He runs a stationery retail shop besides being actively in farming.

Robert has made a request for a loan of 62,400 Kes to buy and insure a dairy cow. He says improved farming income will help him meet his needs and establish a stable foundation for his family. He plans to venture into poultry farming and increase the number of his dairy cows.

He says bad weather and animal diseases are his greatest challenges.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a married woman with three children, all of whom finished school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family.

For the past six years, she has been buying and also making roofing material woven out of coconut fronds and reselling it from her home to her customers. She faces a major challenge of high transport expenses and seasonality. She dreams of starting a kiosk.

With the Kshs. 20,000 she wants to purchase additional roofing materials for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to uplift her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase roofing materials woven out of coconut fronds for resale

loans.name: Zahraa

texts.en:
Zahraa is a 27-year-old married woman, mother of two children, and she has been working  in the art business for eight years.

Zahraa is a hard worker. She paints special requested pictures and designs on house walls and mostly restaurants to add some beautiful decorations. She also draws and paints on glass. Her talent is improving through experience, and she works upon  customers' request.

Zahraa applied for a Youth Loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy necessary painting tools and paints for her business. She helps her husband in making their living and she takes good care of her children.

Zahraa's good  reputation has helped a lot in improving her business and income. She hopes to stay recommended by her customers to expand her business more and more in the future.

loans.use: To buy necessary painting tools and paints for her business

loans.name: Ogla

texts.en:
Ogla is a mother of four children and has been in farming for ten years. She says farming has been her only source of income. She runs her farm with the help of one farmhand.

Ogla has requested a loan of 62,400 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She is optimistic about the business growth and is focusing on having a farm of three quality dairy cows and ranking among the established dairy farmers.

She says animal diseases remain a challenge.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 29-year-old single man who has been working in selling mobile phones, prepaid cards and accessories for six years. He is a hardworking man with a good reputation, well known in his area. 

Ali works a lot on improving and expanding his business, that's why he applied for a Youth Loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to increase his prepaid cards capital through buying a big amount at a special discount.

This is Ali's first experience as an Al Majmoua borrower, and he hopes that through investing this loan in the proper way, he will be capable of improving and expanding his business through opening another branch in the future.

loans.use: To increase his prepaid cards capital through buying a big amount at a special discount

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.en:
Eulalia works hard to support her family. Eulalia is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

Eulalia has been in this business for 25 years now, and also earns additional income from fish vending.

In the future, Eulalia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

loans.name: Fedelina

texts.en:
Fedelina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 44 years.

She requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for her tailoring business. In the future, Fedelina would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Sahaya

texts.en: Sahaya is 45 years old and married with 2 children. With one child in school, Sahaya works very hard to provide for them. She runs a copra retail business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of copra to sell. (Copra is dried coconut meat from which coconut oil is extracted.) She has been in this business for 8 years. In the future Sahaya would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of copra to sell.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is married with 4 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Amalia is 31 years old and has four children who are in school. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and has been in this business for 5 years.

Amalia requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell. In the future, she would like to save money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Anacil

texts.en:
Anacil is 31 years old and has 2 children. She is married and her 2 children are in school. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for 6 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. In the future, Anacil would like to save money to expand her business and send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buying and selling of bananas business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years now.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of bananas to sell. In the future, Marilyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of bananas to sell.

loans.name: Imad

texts.en:
Imad is a 43-year-old married man, father of three children, who has been working in the upholstery business for 20 years.

Imad's business is unique these days, very rarely do people still do this kind of work, and that's why Imad has to do his best to keep his business number one, and to improve it as much as he can to keep his customers pleased.

Imad's business is known as Arabian Upholstery. He fixes wool mattresses and quilts. Imad applied for a loan for the first time from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy necessary textiles, highly requested in his business.

Imad hopes that his business will continue to be recommended by his customers and will attract new customers in the future.

loans.use: To buy necessary textiles for his business

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is 30 years old and married with 2 children.  With both children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Flordeliza runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

She has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future, Flordeliza would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela is 44 years old and married with 8 children. She earns a living by buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Adela is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to raise and sell.

Adela has been buying and selling livestock for three years and also earns additional income from her general store and rice retailing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional livestock animals to raise and sell

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is married with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Yolanda is 57 years old and has 2 children who are in school.

Yolanda has a cheese making business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase ingredients for cheese making.

She has been in this business for 32 years. In the future, Yolanda would like to save money to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for cheese making.

loans.name: Mwanamkasi

texts.en:
Mwanamkasi is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

For the past 7 years, she has operated a weaving business, making roofing materials from coconut leaves and selling them from her home to her customers. She faces a major challenge of transportation and seasonality. She dreams of opening a kiosk.

With the Kshs. 20,000 she wants to purchase a stock of rice, sugar, maize flour, wheat flour and cooking oil to start a kiosk. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to uplift her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase a stock of rice, sugar, maize flour, wheat flour and cooking oil to start a kiosk.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 56 years old and married with 2 children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional goods to sell.

She has borrowed and paid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from fattening pigs and vending vegetables.

Evangeline aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional goods to sell.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah works hard to support her family. She is married and has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years.

She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials needed for her abaca weaving business. In the future, Leah would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her abaca weaving business.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 4 years now, and also earns additional income from her general store.
